item.title: All Valorant Ranks | How to Get Radiant
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/all-valorant-ranks-how-to-get-radiant/

It is no secret that Valorant has one of the biggest esports out there. The popular first-person shooter is a hit with gamers and will continue to grow throughout the years. But what about the game’s ranked mode? Here is a list of all the Valorant Ranks.

All Valorant Ranks

Sure, Valorant has the simple few ranks, including Bronze and Silver, but it also has some of its own unique ranks.

All Valorant Ranks (Worst to Best):

  • Iron I
  • Iron II
  • Iron III
  • Bronze I
  • Bronze II
  • Bronze III
  • Silver I
  • Silver II
  • Silver III
  • Gold I
  • Gold II
  • Gold III
  • Platinum I
  • Platinum II
  • Platinum III
  • Diamond I
  • Diamond II
  • Diamond III
  • Ascendant I
  • Ascendant II
  • Ascendant III
  • Immortal I
  • Immortal II
  • Immortal III
  • Radiant

Valorant’s final few ranks, Ascendant, Immortal and Radiant, are unique to the shooter game. However, reaching them is incredibly difficult, especially with the skill gap in competitive.

How does one reach Radiant in Valorant?

Related: Valorant Challengers Reveal 2025 Changes and More

How to Get Radiant in Valorant

Like other competitive video games, climbing up the ranks in Valorant is simple (in terms, that is). All you have to do is continue to win matches.

Losing will only set you back and push you below in rank. The difficult part about attempting to rank up in Valorant and achieve the Radiant rank is the fact that you have to also rely on teammates.

One of the best suggestions for ranking up is developing a team of five beforehand, and playing ranked together. That way you build up chemistry and can practice as a team, making it easier to climb the ranks together. Doing it solo with random players all the time will only make your journey to Radiant more difficult.

Will you be attempting to get Radiant in Valorant?

For more Insider Gaming esports guides, check out all the ranks in League of Legends.

item.title: Best Goblin Mk2 Loadout in Black Ops 6: Attachments, Perks & Equipment
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/best-goblin-mk2-loadout-in-black-ops-6-attachments-perks-equipment/

If you are looking for the best Goblin Mk2 loadout in Call of Duty Black Ops 6, we have got you covered with the ideal attachments, Perks, and Equipment.

  • Best attachments
  • Best Perks, Wildcard & Equipment
  • Best Secondary for Goblin Mk2
  • How to unlock Goblin Mk2
  • Is the Goblin Mk2 any good in Black Ops 6?
  • Best alternatives

Best Goblin Mk2 loadout attachments in Black Ops 6

  • Muzzle: Suppressor
  • Underbarrel: Ranger Foregrip
  • Magazine: Extended Mag I
  • Rear Grip: Commando Grip
  • Fire Mods: Recoil Springs

The Suppressor will come in handy to hide your position in the minimap, and of course, suppress the gunfire sounds of the AR. The Ranger Foregrip will improve the weapon’s accuracy and mobility by enhancing the horizontal recoil control and sprinting movement speed.

Attach the Extended Mag I and you will have a few extra bullets in the magazines that will be useful in shooting down some more enemies. The Commando Grip will significantly improve the aiming and sprint-to-fire speeds, enhancing the weapon’s handling.

Lastly, attach the Recoil Springs mod for some more improvements in horizontal and vertical recoil control.

Best Perks, Wildcard & Equipment for Goblin Mk2

  • Perk 1: Gung-Ho
  • Perk 2: Assassin
  • Perk 3: Double Time
  • Perk 4: Dexterity
  • Wildcard: Perk Greed
  • Lethal: Semtex
  • Tactical: Stim Shot
  • Field Upgrade: Spring Mine

For Assault Rifle loadouts, Enforcer is the best specialty you can use and it’s no different for the Goblin Mk2. Equip Gung-Ho, Assassin, and Double Time to activate Enforcer and enjoy temporary buffs in movement speeds and health regeneration rates.

Once you unlock Perk Greed, keep Dexterity in the fourth Perk slot. This will ensure you face less weapon sway while sprinting, jumping, and sliding your way through enemies.

Best Secondary for Goblin Mk2

Use the fully automatic pistol, Grekhova, as a secondary weapon with the Goblin Mk2.

How to unlock Goblin Mk2 in Black Ops 6

You need to reach player level 46 to unlock the Tsarkov 7.62 in BO6.

Is the Goblin Mk2 any good in Black Ops 6?

Yes, the Goblin Mk2 offers great TTK and mobility but fails to be among the meta weapons in BO6 because of its slow fire rate.

Best alternatives to the Goblin Mk2 in Black Ops 6

The best alternatives to the Goblin Mk2 in BO6 are XM4 and AS Val. Both of these Assault Rifles are dominating the meta right now, thanks to their insane TTK, fire rates, and mobility.

Stay up to date with all the latest news and guides on Black Ops 6 by signing up for Insider Gaming’s weekly newsletter.
